snp4.9:1.1: “Even when I saw the sirens <j>Craving, Malignancy, and Lust,
snp4.9:1.2: I had no desire for sex.
snp4.9:1.3: What is this body full of piss and shit?
snp4.9:1.4: I wouldn’t even want to touch it with my foot.”
snp4.9:2.1: “If you do not want a gem such as this,
snp4.9:2.2: a lady desired by many rulers of men,
snp4.9:2.3: then what manner of theory, <j>precepts and vows, livelihood,
snp4.9:2.4: and rebirth in a new life do you assert?”
snp4.9:3.3: “none have been adopted thinking, ‘I assert this.’
snp4.9:4.1: “O sage, you speak of judgments you have formed,”
snp4.9:4.3: “without having adopted any of those views.
snp4.9:4.4: As to that matter of ‘inner peace’—
snp4.9:4.5: how is that described by the attentive?”
snp4.9:5.1: “Purity is spoken of not in terms of view,”
snp4.9:5.4: nor in terms of that without view, learning,
snp4.9:5.6: Having relinquished these, not adopting them,
snp4.9:5.7: peaceful, independent, one would not pray <j>for another life.”
snp4.9:6.1: “It seems purity is spoken of not in terms of view,”
snp4.9:6.4: nor in terms of that without view, learning,
snp4.9:6.6: If so, I think this teaching is sheer confusion;
snp4.9:6.7: for some believe in purity in terms of view.”
snp4.9:7.1: “Continuing to question while relying on a view,”
snp4.9:7.3: “you’ve become confused by all you’ve adopted.
snp4.9:7.4: From this you’ve not glimpsed the slightest idea,
snp4.9:7.5: which is why you consider the teaching confused.
snp4.9:8.2: special, or worse’, you’ll dispute about that.
snp4.9:8.3: Not wavering due to the three discriminations,
snp4.9:8.4: you’ll have no thought ‘I’m equal or special’.
snp4.9:9.1: Why would that brahmin say, ‘It’s true’,
snp4.9:9.2: or with whom would they dispute, ‘It’s false’?
snp4.9:9.3: There is no equal or unequal in them,
snp4.9:9.4: so who would they take on in debate?
snp4.9:10.1: After leaving their bastion to migrate without abode,
snp4.9:10.2: a sage doesn’t get close to anyone in town.
snp4.9:10.3: Rid of sensual pleasures, not expecting,
snp4.9:10.4: they wouldn’t get in arguments with people.
snp4.9:11.1: A spiritual giant would not take up for debate
snp4.9:11.2: the things in the world from which they live secluded.
snp4.9:11.3: As a prickly lotus born in the water
snp4.9:11.4: is unsullied by water and mud,
snp4.9:11.5: so the greedless sage, proponent of peace,
snp4.9:11.6: is unsmeared by sensuality and the world.
snp4.9:12.1: A knowledge master does not become conceited
snp4.9:12.2: due to view or thought, <j>for they are not determined by that.
snp4.9:12.3: They’ve no need for deeds or learning,
snp4.9:13.1: There are no ties for one detached from ideas;
snp4.9:13.2: there are no delusions for one freed by wisdom.
